sentences.sContent: And for those who stubbornly suggest pricing above what I believe the market will bear, I say 'best of luck to you.
sentences.sContent_eng: And for those who stubbornly suggest pricing above what I believe the market will bear, I say 'best of luck to you.
sentences.sCn: 对于那些顽固地要求比我认为市场能承受的更高的价码的卖主，我会说上一句：“祝您好运”。

sentences.sContent: Yet the education system—with its continued emphasis on facts and figures and drilling of mental arithmetic—has remained stubbornly rooted in the past.
sentences.sContent_eng: Yet the education system—with its continued emphasis on facts and figures and drilling of mental arithmetic—has remained stubbornly rooted in the past.
sentences.sCn: 但是日本的教育系统——仍在强调事实和数字以及心算的训练——仍固执的深深扎根在过去的土壤之中。

sentences.sContent: People often stubbornly think they are different, especially in a large company such as IBM, whose environments are large and complex.
sentences.sContent_eng: People often stubbornly think they are different, especially in a large company such as IBM, whose environments are large and complex.
sentences.sCn: 人们经常顽固地认为他们是不同的，特别是在公司环境大而复杂的大型公司，例如 IBM。

words.tran: 顽固的；顽强的；难处理的
